title: This Week On Crypto Twitter: Good for Meme Coins, Bad for (Alleged) Crypto Criminals
description: Crypto continued on the path of broad gains this week, creating a giddily optimistic online atmosphere.

title: Snowden Blasts Elizabeth Warren as ‘Pro-Banker,’ Claims She ‘Rolls Over’ for JPMorgan Boss in Crypto Clash
description: This week, the crypto community actively discussed Massachusetts Senator Elizabeth Warren’s remarks labeling crypto as a potential threat. Additionally, JPMorgan boss Jamie Dimon voiced a similar sentiment, asserting he would close crypto down if he held governmental power. In response to Warren and Dimon’s statements, Edward Snowden, the former National Security Agency (NSA) contractor and […]

title: Vladimir Putin reveals his worries about the Western financial system
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin recently shared his views on the Western financial system, characterizing it as “decades-old” and predominantly controlled by the dollar and euro. His remarks, made during the “Russia Calling” forum in Moscow, shed light on the evolving dynamics in the international economic landscape. Vladimir Putin piles into the current western financial system ... Read more

title: China and Singapore collaborate to allow tourists spend the digital yuan
description: Singapore and China recently collaborated on a pilot program aimed at enabling tourists from both nations to utilize China’s central bank digital currency, the digital yuan, during their travels. The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) announced several new digital finance and capital markets initiatives to broaden financial cooperation with China. China and Singapore agree cross ... Read more

title: Crypto industry divided as US government removes AML provisions
description: In a surprising move, the United States government has removed two critical provisions related to cryptocurrency anti-money laundering (AML) regulations from the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA). The NDAA is a significant piece of legislation that determines how the country’s defense department can utilize federal funding. The removal of these provisions has sparked debates and ... Read more

title: DOJ reveals extensive monitoring of Binance operations
description: Binance’s recent compliance commitments with the United States Department of Justice (DOJ), unveiled on December 8, shed light on extensive government oversight of the cryptocurrency exchange’s operations. A comprehensive analysis by John Reed Stark, a former Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) official, characterizes Binance’s newly outlined compliance obligations as resembling a “consulting firm’s wish list,” ... Read more

title: Senior Woman from Israel Multiplies Small Bitcoin Investment into a Fortune; Sets Sights on a New Cryptocurrency
description: A 69-year-old’s gamble into Bitcoin (BTC) turns $3,000 into over $300,000.  The investor, Esther Freeman, now considering investing in Rebel Satoshi ($RBLZ), one of the new ICOs gaining attention.  Rebel Satoshi’s high-flying presale has earned investors a 30% ROI, with more to come. Esther Freeman, a spirited 69-year-old retiree from Israel, turned a humble Bitcoin [...]
